metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5262 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
http/conn/ssl/SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java in Apache HttpComponentsHttpClient before 4.3.6 ignores the http.socket.timeout configurationsetting during an SSL handshake, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (HTTPS call hang) via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5262` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhttpclient-java - 4.4.1-1
libhttpmime-java - 4.4.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libcommons-httpclient-java - 3.1-11ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: httpcomponents-client package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-1').
commons-httpclient package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1-11ubuntu1').
